team.name: Martin Thalmann
team.bio: I’m a passionate DevOps Enthusiast who strongly believes in the power of this movement. As a DevOps and Agile Coach, I support companies in creating more value for their customers. My background as a software developer & project manager as well as my practical experience in different agile roles help me to understand the needs well, find pragmatic solutions and anchor agile principles sustainably. In addition, I am co-study director at the Lucerne University of Applied Sciences and Arts and co-host of the DevOps Meetup Zurich.

team.name: Dirk Lehmann
team.bio: Dirk is a DevOps evangelist and Continuous Delivery expert at SAP. Since 2001 Dirk worked in various roles at SAP including Development and Operations. Together with his former team "TwoGo by SAP" he established the first Continuous Delivery implementation at SAP, delivering value daily to their customers. Dirk is a frequent speaker at international conferences on DevOps and Continuous Delivery.

team.name: Romano Roth
team.bio: I'm a DevOps enthusiast and the Head of DevOps at Zühlke. My passion is helping companies bringing people, processes and technology together so that they can deliver continuously value to their customers.

team.name: Tobias Weinmann
team.bio: Having worked as a developer, systems engineer and team lead in IT operations, the ideas and concepts behind DevOps are very close to my heart. As I am passionate about coding since my teenage years, I am fascinated by concepts like Infrastructure as Code, Social Coding, and cloud native technologies trying to get hands-on whenever possible. I enjoy lateral thinking and my basic premise is that we cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them (Albert Einstein). In my current role I dedicate all my energy to introducing and spreading DevOps principles and practices in the broader organization.

team.name: Selina Reist
team.bio: I am an enthusiast for everything visual:photography, movies and animations, pictograms, infofraphics, visual design, graphical recordings, UX-Design. I also like to combine these skills in crossfunctional teams to enable app development, transformation processes and last but not least communicate and teach DevOps practices in large federal organizations

team.name: Flavio Monigatti
team.bio: Flavio is a passionate advocate for DevOps and MLOps (DevOps for Machine Learning), bringing with him a dynamic enthusiasm for these transformative methodologies. With a rich background in engineering, Flavio is also deeply involved in the practical application of these principles, helping customers realize the benefits of how DevOps and MLOps revolutionizes the way we think about and execute software development and operations.

team.name: Nadine Broghammer
team.bio: Nadine Broghammer is an experienced delivery manager and agile coach. After completing her master’s degree in business administration and management at the University of Zurich, she continously broadend her knowledge and brings a wide range of expertise in requirements engineering, project and product management and as well as a trainer and coach in agile frameworks and delivery. Her focus industries are healthcare as well as banking/finance and transportation. With her direct collaboration style and accessible nature, she ensures a transparent information flow and target focus. Her passion is people relationships and the transformation of corporate practices and strategies.

team.name: Isabel Schacher
team.bio: I'm all about exceptional user experiences, having a background in UX engineering, interaction design, and even game design – because software should be fun, right? Crafting inclusive interfaces in interdisciplinary teams, that work seamlessly and bring smiles to users - that's my jam! Beyond work, I'm a passionate saxophonist. I'm looking forward contributing my skills to the media team of this year's DevOpsDays, ensuring every visitor leaves with a smile.

team.name: Jan Moser
team.bio: Jan Moser works since many years in different software architecture positions for national and international companies. With a background in software engineering, he successfully planned, designed and helped implement solutions in various business fields such as defence, automotive, pharma or finance. Jan works at the moment as lead enterprise architect at TWINT and helps to simplify peoples daily payment processes.

team.name: Franziska Bühler
team.bio: Franziska loves to combine her favorite topics DevOps, IT security and open source software. And that's exactly what she can pursue as an security engineer at SBB! As a former speaker at the DevOpsDays Zurich, organizer of the ModSecurity CRS Meetup Bern and an enthusiastic OWASP member, Franziska also has the opportunity to share her passion with others. When she isn't disassembling highly optimized regexes or automating security, she enjoys spending time with her family.
